thread.title: Clodfelter, Roberts to face off Tuesday in second primary
thread.title_full: Clodfelter, Roberts to face off Tuesday in second primary

title: Clodfelter, Roberts to face off Tuesday in second primary
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Clodfelter, Roberts to face off Tuesday in second primary Voters can make their voices heard Tuesday, as voters will once again head to the polls to make their pick for the democratic candidate in the second mayoral primary for the City of Charlotte. Post to Facebook Clodfelter, Roberts to face off Tuesday in second primary Voters can make their voices heard Tuesday, as voters will once again head to the polls to make their pick for the democratic candidate in the second mayoral primary for the City of Charlotte.  //www.wcnc.com/story/news/politics/elections/2015/10/05/clodfelter-roberts-to-face-off-tuesday-in-second-primary/73426676/   Clodfelter, Roberts to face off Tuesday in second primary Voting for second mayoral primary is Tuesday WCNC WCNC 10:24 p.m. EDT October 5, 2015 CONNECT   
CHARLOTTE, N.C. -- Voters can make their voices heard Tuesday, as voters will once again head to the polls to make their pick for the democratic candidate in the second mayoral primary for the City of Charlotte. 
Democrats Jennifer Roberts and current mayor Dan Clodfelter go head to head because neither of them received 40-percent of the vote in the September primary. 
Both candidates joined NBC Charlotte's Sunday political show, Flashpoint, over the weekend. 
On the show, Roberts says she's confident that voters connect with her message. 
"I will be a tireless advocate for our great city. And I think we need to make sure that success is coming not only to certain parts of our town, but we have to have opportunity coming to every corner of our city," she said. 
Clodfelter believes his recent endorsements from former candidate David Howard gives him the edge. 
"We feel like we're very well positioned for the second primary. I was very pleased to pick up David Howard's endorsement, who was the third-place finisher. We always had very common positions on the issues and what we thought the city should be doing. I was very proud that he agreed to come on board. I think we can push it across the line." 
The winner of Tuesday's second Democratic Primary will face Republican Edwin Peacock in November's General Election.  //www.wcnc.com/story/news/politics/elections/2015/10/05/clodfelter-roberts-to-face-off-tuesday-in-second-primary/73426676/ TOP VIDEOS
